title: Bookmark Folder in Bookmark Toolbar Won't Open
content:
Sometimes a bookmark folder on my toolbar randomly won't open. I can go to Manage Bookmarks and see the bookmarks there, but the folder on the toolbar won't open when I click on it. I haven't changed anything on the folder. Sometimes deleting a bookmark in the folder and restarting Firefox fixes the folder, sometimes it doesn't.

I haven't noticed any errors.

I'm using Firefox 118.0.2 (64-bit) on Ubuntu.
creator: jeff_firefoxaccounts

title: How to STOP the browser translation - preferably permanently
content:
There are already a number of questions related to how to get rid of the stupid pop-up window asking to translate the web pages. I am fluent in 4 languages, I use them all on daily basis and for obvious reasons I cannot keep shifting any system preferences or anything else while switching between languages.

I tried copy the "about:config" which is supposed to prevent the automatic translation from being suggested. It doesn't work - the pop-up still comes. I have even rebooted the computer after. still the pop-up comes for random web pages.

Please for the next release of this otherwise magnificient (non-microsoft) browser fix this irritating feature.

it is not Firefox business to judge whether I understand the language on the pages or not. I want to be able to prevent all attempts at "user friendliness" from the browser.

Please advice when fixed.
creator: DHa

title: close my menu bar (return it to a default) when i sign out
content:
When i use (and by inference... sign into Mozilla) i have a toolbar with several bookmarks - that are specific to my usage. In a way, you could say they are private to my sessions (not specifically the one i am in, but on a recurring basis) and should not be available to others... When I sign out of Mozilla (either manually or as an optional default for when the browser is closed...) I want the bookmark tabs on the toolbar to also go into storage. -->Is this possible (how?)

How sync'd devices are handled is another discussion For now.... let's address this device as an independent connection.
creator: MKub3905

title: Where do notifications to "usefulcontentsite.com" come from?
content:
Sometimes I get notifications from Firefox which send me to "usefulcontentsite.com" (don't click this, might be harmful!) and when I click them, uBlock Origin blocks them. So I'm pretty certain that is spam (or worse). However, I could never attribute this to any page or maybe some harmful extension I have installed. Also, I mostly block site's requests for notifications.

Here is the list of installed add-ons: - ClearURLs (recommended by Mozilla) - Firefox Multi-Account Containers (official extension) - KeePassXC-Browser - uBlock Origin (recommended by Mozilla) - User-Agent Switcher and Manager (recommended by Mozilla)

So imo nothing exotic here.

Does anyone here have a clue where those notifications might come from?

creator: george2050

title: bookmarks sync from browser into subfolder on another browser
content:
Is it possible to perform partial bookmarks sync?

Let's say, bookmarks from machine A that are synced to the server completely would be then synced from the server to a bookmarks subfolder on machine B, is it possible? The rest of the bookmarks on machine B would need not to sync to the server in such case.

Alternatively, both machines sync to the server but the user would need to specify which bookmark sections (folders) need to be synced and which not, thus avoiding duplication and maintaining consistency.
creator: alexei.gusev

title: Support.mozilla.com JS Assets Blocked
content:
The https://support.mozilla.org/ site uses `assets-prod.sumo.prod.web services.mozgcp.net` for delivering JS assets. These are blocked by my proxy because the host is categorized as “we analytics”. Looking at the PTR record for the host returns gives `139.220.110.34.bc.googleusercontent.com` which my proxy blocks.

Also the site seems to use Google Analytics directly.

Please consider getting your JS from the same host used by www.mozilla.org so I can more easily view support articles.

Thank you for your work and making such a great project.

Raúl
creator: raulcuza

title: Facing Issues With Firefox
content: I've been using Firefox as my primary web browser, but I've been experiencing frequent crashes, notifications, and slow performance issues. creator: afrasiabsajid9

title: Disabling GPU makes FF faster (on my machine)
content:
Hello there,

It's more an observation than a question.

FF was slow when several pages with video feeds were opened. Looking at the about:processes, I saw that the GPU usage was high. Disabling hardware acceleration solved this problem.

This occurred on a Dell XPS-15-9520, Win11, i5-12500H, 64GB RAM, Iris Xe. I don't have this problem on Linux machines.

May I suggest to benchmark and monitor hardware acceleration so that both CPU and GPU are used in case of heavy workload?

Many thanks,

Olivier. (very long time, happy, FF user ... )
creator: romarin12

title: click and drag scrolling is always extremely slow
content:
When I highlight text and move my cursor down to the bottom edge of the screen to scroll, it is super slow when going down. However if I do the same and scroll upwards by moving my mouse cursor to the top edge to scroll, it scrolls at a reasonable fast rate. The issue does not fix when I start in safe mode, or in private windows. The issue is exclusive to highlighting text and holding down to scroll. My scroll speed by clicking the scroll bar is normal, and so is using two fingers on my laptop (Asus Zenbook 14) to scroll down.

I don't encounter slow click and drag scrolling on google chrome.
